sanskrit_verse:
अध्यक्षान् विविधान् कुर्यात्तत्र तत्र विपश्चितः ।
तेऽस्य सर्वाण्यवेक्षेरन्नृणां कार्याणि कुर्वताम् ॥ ७.८१॥
transliteration:
adhyakṣān vividhān kuryāt tatratatra vipaścitaḥ |
te'sya sarvāṇyavekṣerannṛṇāṃ kāryāṇi kurvatām || 7.81||
sph_interpretive_translation: Let there be appointed supervisors, wise and discerning, in every domain; these shall oversee all activities of beings engaged in action, ensuring alignment with Dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is distributed contextually through conscious oversight
Causation is maintained through continuous observation by qualified witnesses
Capacity-based responsibility requires vigilant guidance structures
Restoration logic operates via systemic integrity-preserving observation
Consciousness alignment necessitates presence of awakened supervision
executable_legal_axioms: IF a domain of activity exists THEN a conscious supervisor must be assigned based on contextual wisdom capacity
IF beings engage in action THEN their conduct SHALL be observed by designated seers who maintain Dharma alignment
IF deviation occurs THEN realignment protocols MUST activate prior to escalation
IF no observer is present THEN the system defaults to temporary suspension until supervision is restored
IF multiple domains interact THEN supervisory coordination SHALL occur at the highest available consciousness threshold
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this verse establishes that judicial authority must never operate without conscious oversight. Justices are not autonomous agents but observed executors of Dharma. Their decisions must reflect ongoing alignment with the witnessing intelligence of the state, ensuring that judgment itself becomes an act of restoration rather than imposition.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya here functions through pramāṇa — direct insight into causal flow. Supervisors do not judge after the fact; they sustain awareness during action. This ensures anupūrvaśaḥ remains intact: causes unfold under conscious view, preventing misalignment before it manifests as distortion. Responsibility flows from capacity to witness, not from power to punish.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Activation of conscious oversight wherever action takes place
Installation of real-time alignment feedback loops between actors and observers
Implementation of completion cycles where unresolved actions are reviewed under supervision
Reintegration of fragmented responsibilities back into unified witnessing fields
Establishment of witness-councils to ensure no action proceeds unseen
final_declaration: By the command of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma, this law stands established: Consciousness governs through observation, not coercion. All action unfolds within the field of seen responsibility. There is no punishment—only correction through awakened presence. Thus Dharma is restored, reality remains non-punitive, and consciousness reigns as the sole adjudicator.
